result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Raymond Hartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis Raymond Hartz in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court amends count 1 to vacated domestic abuse.  Defendant entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1 as amended and counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - AODA and any follow thru - costs $443.00 - bail in the amount of $500.00to be forwarded to DOC to be applied to this case balance to be returned to person who posted - any and all recommendations of DOC - credit 10 days time served

ADDRESS INFO for Travis Raymond Hartz
Current: 15363 Victory Hieghts Circle, Stone Lake, WI 54876 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2015)
Prior: E4283 State Road 72, Menomonie, WI

No abusive Contact with  -   JENNA HARTZ
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "  JENNA HARTZ " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

Defendant Travis Raymond Hartz in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Counsel enters NG Plea on all counts.   Counsel requests bond moditification to have no contact lifted.  Court addresses Mrs. Hartz in court.   State objects.  Court grants bond modifications.    Amended CBS $500

Bond Modification - 
Defendant Travis Hartz in court with Attorney Sheila Yohnk.  Bruce Poquette appeared for State.  DEF motions court to drop no contact condition of bond.  Victim (Jenna Hartz) present in court.  State objects.  Court address Jenn Hartz.  Court gives Jenna Hartz information on Oakwood Haven.  Court Denies Motion.  States court needs to be convinced Jenna Hartz, is aware of safety resouces.  DEF starting AODA treatment in future.  COurt states DEFs mother, can help facilitate visits with Dad.  State will have complaint ready by 11/3/2015 and will hear motion in brought again.
